title: Front ABS Wheel Speed Sensor - Installation

body.body: Front ABS Wheel Speed Sensor - Installation
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
If adjustment is required, use the original fixing for the selection of the shim. Fit a new fixing when the new shim has been selected and fitted.
Position the wheel speed sensor and shim to the fork leg, as noted for removal. Fit the original fixing and tighten to
Route the harness as noted for removal and connect the wheel speed sensor electrical connector to the main harness.
Attach the sensor harness to its clips on the left front brake line.
The air gap between the wheel speed sensor and the pulser ring must be between 0.37 mm and 1.23 mm. Check, and if necessary, adjust the air gap (see
If the air gap measurement is between 0.37 mm and 1.23 mm, remove the original fixing, fit a new fixing and tighten to
Attach the wheel speed sensor conduit to the harness fit a new fixing and tighten to
